updated_cases.title: For the Altos disabled tenant , Verify the page events and nspolicy event for following categories
updated_cases.custom_summary:
For the Altos disabled tenant , Verify the page events and nspolicy event for following categories
Security Risk - Command & Control Server
Security Risk -Phising/Fraud
Security Risk-Spam Sites
Security Risk-Botnets
Security Risk-Compromised/malicious Sites
Security Risk
updated_cases.custom_steps:
From the Explicit proxy mode access following Category URL
Security Risk - Command & Control Server
Security Risk -Phising/Fraud
Security Risk-Spam Sites
Security Risk-Botnets
Security Risk-Compromised/malicious Sites
Security Risk
updated_cases.custom_expected: If the Altos is disabled then we should not generate the page event and Nspolicy event

updated_cases.title: Verify the Custom Category hit ,when we add following in custom category
updated_cases.custom_summary:

Security Risk - Command & Control Server
Security Risk -Phising/Fraud
Security Risk-Spam Sites
Security Risk-Botnets
Security Risk-Compromised/malicious Sites
Security Risk
updated_cases.custom_steps:

Security Risk - Command & Control Server
Security Risk -Phising/Fraud
Security Risk-Spam Sites
Security Risk-Botnets
Security Risk-Compromised/malicious Sites
Security Risk
2.Create the policy for the same
3.Access mentioned Category sites and verify the Category_ID in policy hit events

updated_cases.title: Verify the Nspolicy event when we add all the url in inclusion urllist
updated_cases.custom_summary:
Verify the Nspolicy event when we add following Category url in inclusion and exclusion list

Security Risk - Command & Control Server
Security Risk -Phising/Fraud
Security Risk-Spam Sites
Security Risk-Botnets
Security Risk-Compromised/malicious Sites
Security Risk
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1.Add following Category url in the Include and exclude weblist of the Custom category

Security Risk - Command & Control Server
Security Risk -Phising/Fraud
Security Risk-Spam Sites
Security Risk-Botnets
Security Risk-Compromised/malicious Sites
Security Risk
2.Create the policy for the same
3.Access following Category sites and verify the Category_ID in policy hit events

Security Risk - Command & Control Server
Security Risk -Phising/Fraud
Security Risk-Spam Sites
Security Risk-Botnets
Security Risk-Compromised/malicious Sites
Security Risk
updated_cases.custom_expected:
We should get custom Category hit the url belongs to Inclusion list
We should not get custom Category hit the url belongs to exclusion list

updated_cases.custom_steps:

Verify the bypass event

updated_cases.title: Verify that the category "Ad Fraud" is mapped under the source "Netskope Threat Intelligence" in the db
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Log into mysql
2. Go to app_info db
3. verify the category is mapped under the source 'Netskope Threat Intelligence'
updated_cases.custom_expected: category 'Ad Fraud' should be mapped under the source 'Netskope Threat Intelligence' in the db
